title: Binance Chain registers a 229% surge in this metric- Are investors happy about it? - AMBCrypto News
content:
Binance Chain’s daily transactions recorded a year-to-date growth of 229%.

The network’s NFT trading volume declined sharply in February.

Binance Chain [BNB] recorded a big jump in its daily transaction volume over the week, rising from 3.5 million to over 5 million at the time of writing.

While this amounted to a nearly 47% rise, a closer look at the data revealed that the chain’s year-to-date (YTD) growth was also impressive. BNB chain’s total transactions have more than doubled since the start of 2023.

Something is happening on BSC. Daily transactions are suddenly up from 3.5M earlier this week to over 5M today. pic.twitter.com/b7GVzkjD9u — Patrick | Dynamo DeFi (@Dynamo_Patrick) March 3, 2023

Furthermore, the Binance chain registered a 50% growth in its daily active users (DAUs) since the start of the week, according to Token Terminal.

Due to the increase in the number of DAUs, the protocol’s transaction fees also expanded by 21% in the same time period.

Read Binance Coin’s [BNB] Price Prediction 2023-24

It’s a flop show on DeFi, NFT front!

The growth in network adoption could be due to some big-ticket launches in its NFT vertical. On 1 March, a platform named Bicassso was unveiled by Binance, which would combine artificial intelligence (AI) and non-fungible token (NFT) technology.

However, data from Santiment narrated a different story. Barring the short-term upticks at different intervals, the total NFT trading volume has plunged 67% from the peak of 6 February until 2 March.

BNB Chain’s performance on the DeFi front also left a lot to be desired. The total value locked (TVL) declined by 12% over the last three weeks and dipped well below $7 billion.

Is your portfolio green? Check the Binance Coin Profit Calculator

Is BNB heading toward losses?

Binance Coin has shed more than 6% of its value in the last week and was down 2.7% in the last 24 hours, as per data from CoinMarketCap.

The Relative Strength Index (RSI) fell sharply over the last 10 days and dipped below 40, at the time of writing. This indicated that BNB faced increased selling pressure and could sink further.

The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) suggested a bearish outcome for the coin as well while the On Balance Volume (OBV) showed a marginal drop.

These indicators sounded a warning alarm for BNB and the support at $289 might not hold for good.

title: All the Times Sister Wives' Meri Brown's Bed-and-Breakfast Retreats Were Slammed By Fans - Yahoo Entertainment
content:
Yikes! Sister Wives star Meri Brown has been slammed by critics for her expensive Lizzie’s Heritage Inn retreats. Most of the time, her bed-and-breakfast was criticized for its prices. During season 12 of the hit TLC reality series, Meri first revealed that she wanted to take over the Parowan, Utah, inn. Although her former husband, Kody Brown, wasn’t initially keen on the idea, the plural family later warmed up to it, and Meri has proudly promoted her bed-and-breakfast ever since then. The reality TV star’s inn has received accolades in the past, including the Official Best of America’s “Best Country Inn” award in 2018 and 2019. Meri even added a personal touch to the location, including beautiful antiques and a simplistic, country theme for guests to enjoy. However, her inn quickly faced the wrath from fans after she promoted the hotel’s first-ever retreat in November 2022, which offered a package that ranged in price from “$4,500 to $6,400 depending on if you want the VIP treatment or not,” she said in a Facebook video at the time. The four-day retreat’s packages included breakfast, lunch and dinner, with Meri explaining that the occasion would offer a “weekend of adventure.” She elaborated that the getaway was intended to focus on “inspiration” and “connection.” Upon noticing the sky-high costs, fans took to the comments section under Meri’s video to weigh in about the expenses. “Wow! That pricing is absolutely insane! You have officially lost my respect,” one person wrote, whereas another pointed out, “Yikes. I can go to Disney World for that price.” Nevertheless, the former sister wife kept her head up and reflected on the backlash in an Instagram post following the retreat. “Inner peace and self-reflection is something many of us forget about, as we go along our day to day being busy, taking care of all the daily tasks, and serving others,” Meri captioned her post at the time. “It’s so important to take time to tune out the noise and distractions so you can figure out what is most important to YOU. … Don’t let yourself get distracted by the voices of others, voices that have no part in your story. Live your life with passion and joy! Remember, you’re worthy of having all you want in your life. You deserve it, and you’re worth it!” However, this wasn’t the last time that the Sister Wives cast member has encountered backlash from fans for her bed-and-breakfast. She was slammed by countless online users once again in January 2023 for boasting about a similar excursion with exorbitant prices. Scroll down to see all the times fans slammed Meri for her expensive inn retreats.

title: PancakeSwap Prepare V3 Release with $135K Airdrop and Exclusive NFTs - BSC NEWS
content:
BNB

PancakeSwap is launching its V3 platform in April and is offering an early supporter campaign with a $135K CAKE airdrop and an exclusive NFT to users who maintain their liquidity in selected pools April 3, 2023.

PancakeSwap V3 Launch Campaign

PancakeSwap has announced the release of V3 in the first week of April, 2023 and has accompanied the exciting news with a special early supporter campaign.

The team exclusively revealed to BSC News that the new PancakeSwap V3 platform, which will launch in the first week of April, will offer competitive trading fees, trading incentives, improved liquidity provisioning, and yield farming experience.

"We're excited to continue our mission of bringing DeFi to everyone with the launch of PancakeSwap V3. The new features we're introducing will offer our users an even better experience and help make DeFi accessible to more people than ever before," said Mochi, Head Chef of PancakeSwap.

Celebratory Reward Campaign

To celebrate the launch of PancakeSwap V3, the platform will be airdropping $135,000 USD in CAKE and an exclusive PancakeSwap V3 NFT to early supporters. The campaign will run from March 5th, 2023 at 13:00 UTC to April 3rd, 2023 at 12:00 UTC.

Part 1 of the campaign involves maintaining a minimum of $500 USD liquidity staked in BUSD/WBNB, USDT/WBNB, BTCB/WBNB, or ETH/WBNB liquidity pools on PancakeSwap's Masterchef v2.

Users who maintain their liquidity until April 3rd, 2023, will be eligible to receive a share of the $105,000 USD worth of CAKE airdrop, based on the tiers listed on PancakeSwap's website. Users who remove their liquidity during the campaign period will be disqualified.

Part 2 of the campaign doubles the rewards for participants. Existing users who have qualified for Part 1 can add an additional $500 to $20,000 liquidity in the same selected liquidity pools to qualify for a share of the $30,000 worth of CAKE airdrop.

New users must add a minimum of $500 to $20,000 liquidity in the selected pools between March 5th, 2023 at 13:00 UTC to March 18th, 2023 at 12:00 UTC, and maintain it until April 3rd, 2023 at 12:00 UTC, to be eligible for the additional airdrop. The same disqualification rules apply as in Part 1.

In addition to the airdrop rewards, users who participate in Part 1 of the campaign will receive an exclusive PancakeSwap V3 Legend NFT as a symbol of their loyalty and support for PancakeSwap.

To maximize rewards, PancakeSwap encourages users to take advantage of the new APR adjustments and explore different pools. Users can find all necessary information about the PancakeSwap V3 Early Supporter Campaign on the PancakeSwap website.

What is PancakeSwap:

PancakeSwap is a Decentralized Exchange (DEX) built on BNB Chain. It offers users various features such as Liquidity Pools (LPs), swapping, yield farming, Syrup Pools, an Automated Market Maker, Initial Farm Offerings (IFOs), an NFT profile system, and other tools.

In addition, the protocol helps users make the most out of their crypto assets by trading, earning through yield farming, and winning via lottery, prediction, and NFT collectibles. With the highest trading volumes in the market, PancakeSwap is the leading DEX on BNB Chain.

title: Financial institutions and corporate offices “hollowing out” - Kuensel, Buhutan's National Newspaper
content:
… employees are having to deal with fatigue

Rinzin Wangchuk

The high rate of attrition is “hollowing out” financial institutions and corporate offices of their human resources even as some of these agencies are moving their services online.

Among the financial institutions (FIs), Royal Insurance Corporation of Bhutan Limited’s (RICBL) head office in Thimphu never had so many of its cubicles vacant. “We have been hollowed out due to a high attrition rate, RICBL’s Chief Executive Officer (CEO) Karma said. “This happens with key people resigning for better opportunities.”

RICBL, which has about 450 employees across the country, saw a total of 80 employees exit from 2022 to date. The company’s office in Thimphu alone lost 60 employees, mostly key people. RICBL has a regional office in Phuentsholing and 25 branch offices spread across the country.

The insurance company has announced 60 vacancies to fill up the human resource gap.

“We will not replace all of them since we are moving our services and products online such as our mobile application, MyRICBL, through which one can pay loan instalments, insurance and avail of other services,” RICBL Chief Executive Officer Karma said.









“We will reskill and upskill existing staff to assume the vacant posts,” he said. “We’ll be multitasking.”

Karma said that the management is also aware of the risk of employees becoming fatigued. “As they multitask for a long duration, their productivity will drop and there will be the risk of making errors. So in as many areas as possible, we will use technology,” he said.

He said that since the organisations in Bhutan cannot stop people from leaving, the smart way to manage is to invest in increasing the productivity of those who remain. “Resource management is crucial in ensuring productivity.”

RICBL, the second oldest financial institution in the country, is the only multi-faceted financial service provider in Bhutan catering life insurance, general insurance, credit facilities and other social security schemes. Incorporated on January 7, 1975, under the Royal Charter, RICBL is a public limited company with 39 percent of the total shares held by the government and the rest 61 percent by the public and private organisations and individuals.

While Bhutan Development Bank Corporation Limited (BDBL) lost a significant number of staff over one year, the bank officials said that there was not much impact on the human resource capacity. “The moratorium imposed on loans by the central bank in May last year had reduced the workload of employees. The bank caters services to in rural communities.









Of the total 576 employees, 105 employees excluding five general managers left BDBL. “If the loans were not suspended, we have to recruit the same number of employees who left the bank,” an official said.

Following a directive from the Royal Monetary Authority, BDBL suspended sanctioning loans because of high non-performing loans (NPL). NPL are loans with payments that are overdue by 90 days or more.

The attrition rate in Bhutan National Bank (BNB) is also not as high as other FIs are facing today. As of December 2022, only 23 staff resigned from the total human resource strength of 521. However, the bank lost eight employees and another eight took extraordinary leave (EOL) in January and February this year, according to BNB officials.

“As of now, the employees are multitasked to cater services and we don’t face a major challenge,” an official said.

The country’s oldest financial institution, Bank of Bhutan Limited (BoBL) saw 49 employees exit in 2022 and 21 staff in the past two months. The bank officials said that it is a bit early to comment on recruitment since the organisational development exercise (OD) hasn’t been completed.

Other agencies

People migrating to Australia, Canada and other countries have also equally impacted other corporate agencies and employees are fatigued with multiple responsibilities.









For instance, National Housing Corporation Limited (NHDCL) is facing serious challenges of not being able to do succession planning given the current trend of employees leaving in large numbers and in an ad-hoc manner.

“Unless there are some policy level interventions, it will be next to impossible to encourage people to stay back,” NHDCL’s CEO Rinchen Wangdi said.

NHDCL has a total staff strength of 147 as of March 2 this year. In 2022, the company saw 20 employees including engineers and architects leave the company and another five resigned in the past two months.

The overall impact due to staff resigning in large numbers to the organisation, according to Rinchen Wangdi, is the additional work for those who are left behind and the difficulty in maintaining the continuity of the ongoing work especially when it is an important project.

He said that employees leaving suddenly with one month’s notice period and some even shorter periods create great inconvenience to the office.

“When those who are looking after important and complex projects leave suddenly are the worst cases since it takes time for the new one to understand the complexity and background of the project,” Rinchen Wangdi said. “There are chances of lapses that might happen due to short overlap or no overlap between the two.”









He also said that those who agree to take up the additional work are not able to focus on their work at hand and end up working extra time on a daily basis and even sacrificing their weekends.

“This affects their mental health,” he said adding that there are many who are contemplating resigning due to the stress from additional work.

The CEO also said that even the division heads including the head of organisation had to step in to fill the human resources gap since those leaving are mostly mid-level professionals with substantial experience.

“Management is not able to concentrate on bigger issues and at the strategy level since they are bogged down with the minor issues,” he said.

Some agencies also find it difficult to get replacements from the open market. “It takes time and resources for the new recruit to learn,” an official said. “There are no candidates even in the market for some of the key positions like finance and project management.”









Many new employees who join the office, according to one of the corporate officials, are also in transit mode since there is no guarantee these people will not leave. There are many instances where new recruits also left the company not long after joining the office. “Unless there are some policy level interventions, it will be next to impossible to encourage people to stay back,” he said.

Bhutan Power Corporation (BPC) saw its highest attrition rate of 12.14 percent in 2022, according to an official from the human resource department. Of the total 2,415 employees in January 2022, 282 resigned and the company recruited 99 employees in the same year.

The attrition rate in January and February this year stands at 11.12 percent. 41 employees separated in just two months. As of February 28, BPC has a total staff strength of 2,191.

BPC officials said that one department lost seven engineers in one year. “Because of the loss of engineers, we are facing problems in the office to solve technical issues,” the official said.

title: Airbnb SWOT Analysis - Business Model Analyst
content:
Airbnb is a name that has become almost synonymous with the rental industry. The company rose to prominence after it disrupted the traditional hotel industry and has since attempted to dominate other sectors within the travel and hospitality industry. Let’s take a look at the Airbnb SWOT analysis to fully understand just how the company was able to achieve this.

A Brief Look at Airbnb

Airbnb is a major player in the rental and booking sector and has introduced an innovative model when it comes to rental services. The company is well known for its effective branding, and marketing itself as more than just a company that provides houses, but one which also provides the experience of home.

Through the use of strategic partnerships and acquisitions, the brand has quickly built itself to be one of the strongest and most rounded players in the market. It is involved in various areas, such as luxury rentals, food technology, home listings, and so on.

The company has been seeing strong growth over the last few years and has cemented its position as a dominant player in the market with a quarter of the market share. Let’s take a look at the strings, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats to this highly successful business.

Airbnb Strengths

Here are some of the competitive advantages enjoyed by Airbnb.

Airbnb Enjoys First-Mover Advantage

Airbnb was undoubtedly not the first company to attempt to introduce a novel business model into the hospitality industry, it was the first to do it successfully and at scale. The beneficial phenomenon associated with being the first popularly successful business in an industry is known as a first-mover advantage. As its name suggests, it comes with several perks.

First of all, first-movers enjoy a great deal of brand awareness, customer loyalty, and a positive brand association. This is because, initially, being the sole product on the market naturally creates a strong relationship between customers and the brand. It also gives the brand more time to build vital supply chain structures and partnerships, which gives them an advantage over future competition.

While these advantages typically do not last forever, by the time other significant players in the industry may have appeared, a first-mover company like Airbnb must have carved out a significant part of the market share as well as positioned its brand favorably.

It Takes Advantage of the Network Effect

The network effect is another helpful phenomenon within the business world. It describes a situation where the value and quality of a product or service increase when an increasing number of people utilize it. Airbnb is also a company that takes advantage of this phenomenon. This is because an increasing number of renters will attract more hosts to the platform, which in turn increases the available listings and attracts more renters.

Also, if enough people have positive experiences while using the platform, this will act as free marketing since they would recommend it to others. This eventually encourages hosts to put more effort into ensuring that customers have a positive experience with their services and, by extension, give positive reviews. All these eventually form positive feedback loops where growth promotes further escalation of the platform.

Innovative Business Model

One of the greatest strengths of the Airbnb company is the innovative business model which it introduced into the hospitality and rental industry. Airbnb is designed as a community-based, two-sided platform that helps facilitate listings and bookings between hosts and renters. The company does not own or manage any of the properties which it advertises, merely acting as a middleman in the rental process (while charging them a fee for this service).

There are several advantages to their business model. Firstly, their system allows the company to advertise a much wider range of properties than other traditional traveling agencies and hotel chains. Hosts are also not charged a fee for listing the property, only when the location is rented out. Hosts are also able to set their prices, allowing them to undercut the hotels since they do not have to worry about expensive overhead costs like maintenance, wages, booking fees, and hotel taxes. These cheaper prices are passed along to customers, thereby incentivizing them to choose Airbnb over travel agencies.

Customers, on the other hand, also have greater flexibility when it comes to renting options. Airbnb offers a range of listing options ranging from high-end luxurious locations to cozy one-bedroom listings depending on what the customer desires. This exposes renters to a broader range of experiences rather than being stuck with the stereotypical hotel experience, thereby enhancing customer experience.

Strong Branding and Effective Marketing

In the last few years, Airbnb has focused on promoting a new marketing campaign headlined“Belong Anywhere,” which is targeted toward creating a more inclusive and community-driven brand. The company explained that the primary motivation behind this campaign was to push the public’s perception of the company away from being merely a rental site to one that provides an authentic home-like experience.

This rebranding effort included a new logo (named the “Bélo,” which represents people, place, love, and the “a” of Airbnb), as well as a greater degree of customer interaction through their revamped distribution channels. The platform also added a “Discover” feature, which allowed renters to explore exotic listing locations through a collage of locations and rentals.

They Offer a Unique Traveling Experience

A vital part of the Airbnb brand identity is its ability to offer customers a unique traveling experience. Many times, hotels have been accused of offering stereotypical and artificial guest experiences. However, by using the services of Airbnb, guests can immerse themselves in the local culture by choosing to list options that are more deeply embedded within the community. This allows them to enjoy authentic holiday experiences as well as widens their worldview.

Airbnb promotes this in several ways. We have already mentioned their “Discover” feature, which exposes renters to potential locations in listing options, but they also have several other valuable features such as “Experiences” and “Places” pages. The “Experiences” page allows users to explore fun local activities which are available around the rental area, such as pottery, hiking, and camping. “Places,” on the other hand, inform renters of iconic locations such as amusement parks, monuments, and scenic restaurants.

The Company Is Publicly Traded

Airbnb is a publicly traded company and therefore enjoys the advantages that come with this. For example, when the company went public in 2020, its shares gained 112% in just the first day of training. This IPO allowed the company to raise significant amounts of risk-free capital rather quickly, as well as improve its attractiveness to investors. Another advantage of this is that stock options are an excellent way for companies to compete in the labor market and hire the best talent.

Aside from the favorable media coverage offered by such public offerings, customers also have more confidence in publicly traded companies. Publicly traded companies are also audited more frequently and closely than private firms, allowing for greater transparency, credibility, and investor confidence as well.

Global Expansion

From its humble beginnings in San Francisco, Airbnb has grown into an international brand with over 6 million listings, 4 million hosts, and 150 million users, who have booked over 1 billion stays in more than 100, 000 cities in over 220 countries. This level of global reach gives the company a significant competitive advantage over its closest rivals as well as the ability to cater to the needs of a wide range of customers through cheaper prices and more options.

Dual Rating System

The booking and hospitality industry is built on reputation and customer experience. Therefore, Airbnb introduced a dual rating system, which allows both renters and hosts to make mutual assessments of their experience.

This creates an incentive for both renters and hosts to be on their best behavior. This is because hosts with higher ratings will see their listings being utilized more often. On the other hand, notoriously troublesome renters will be rated poorly by the platform and may even be barred from using their services.

Strategic Partnerships and Acquisitions

Airbnb is a company well known for its strategic partnerships and acquisitions, with the company spending well over $700 million on building a strong network that allows you to capitalize on various supply chains within the hospitality industry. These investments include areas such as social platforms, online travel, and even food technology.

Some of the key purchases made by the company include HotelTonight (a travel agency and metasearch engine acquired by the company for $450 million in 2019), Luxury Retreats (a rental service that specializes in luxury rentals which the company purchased in 2017 for $200-$300 million), Accomable (a London-based holiday booking platform which the company acquired in 2017 for an undisclosed amount), and so on.

Healthy Balance Sheet and Gross Margin

Despite its not-so-distant struggles or profitability, Airbnb, for most of its history, has maintained a healthy balance sheet and large gross revenue. This is quite encouraging to investors and suggests that the company has strong potential for future growth due to its strong financial position. Also, the company has been posting steadily increasing revenues over the last few years, generating revenues of over $8.4 billion in 2022, a 40% YoY increase, and its first fully profitable year with a net profit of $1.9 billion that same year.

Airbnb Weaknesses

Here are some of the weaknesses of the company.

The Company Initially Struggled With Profitability

Although Airbnb was launched in 2008 and has raked in billions of dollars in revenue over the past few years, for an extended period, the company struggled with profitability and first managed to achieve an annual net profit in 2017, before briefly lapsing back into net losses the following year.

While this may be considered a normal part of the business’s development plan, with many businesses focusing on growth and achieving a significant market share even at the expense of profitability, it may be worrisome to investors. This is especially true because the company operates within a sector famous for its volatility and unpredictable nature, as evidenced by the downturn experienced in the industry during the pandemic.

Ever-Changing Legal Regulations

Airbnb introduced a relatively new business model into the hospitality and tourism industry. As expected, there was a prolonged period of confusion and lack of regulation due to the inexperience of the law with such a system. However, over time, new regulations have sprung up as lawmakers and other stakeholders within the industry have become familiar with both the direct and indirect consequences of such a business model.

While not all of these regulations may be detrimental to the success of Airbnb, uncertain future regulations create an unfavorable business environment that may scare off investors. For example, some cities have created legal frameworks burning the use of short-term rentals, such as Airbnb listings. While they may have credible reasons for this, it negatively affects Airbnb rentals in these regions.

Their Business Model Is Easy to Imitate

Even though Airbnb was the first company to introduce its business model into the hospitality and rental industry, it did not remain alone for long. The Airbnb business model is relatively easy to imitate, and it is cheaper for competitors to build on a business model which has already been designed. Therefore, the company now faces greater market share competition.

Some Hosts Charge Inflated Prices

Despite their focus on offering cheaper alternatives to the hotel industry, because Airbnb does not directly interfere with how the hosts price their properties, some hosts have been known to offer inflated prices when compared with the services offered. This affects customer experience negatively and creates a poor brand image for the company.

Claims of Fraudulent Activities

Airbnb’s rentals have been accused of being a part of several fraudulent activities. A popular example is what is known as bait and switch scams, in which a particular rental property will be listed for a price. Still, upon choosing the property, the renter will be redirected to a more expensive property listed elsewhere.

Other types of scams the company has been involved in include multiple listings, inaccurate descriptions of property, account hacking, the use of doctored images, fake customer reviews, and illegal payments made outside the platform. Also, some authorities have claimed that Airbnb’s are popular among criminal elements due to the reduced amount of scrutiny that hosts may put on their guests.

Accusations of Racial Discrimination

Airbnb has long been the subject of controversy surrounding accusations of racial discrimination against people of color and other minorities. A 2015 study from Harvard showed that individuals with names that sound like they may belong to a minority have a more difficult time booking on the platform. This caused significant controversy within the company and further encouraged them to tighten the non-discrimination policy when it comes to hosts. However, the stain of the scandal is still yet to fully fade, especially with more instances of hosts discriminating against ethnic minorities and people of color.

Poor Search Engine Optimization

One complaint that many users have had is difficulty in finding Airbnb listings from a search engine. The top listings are more likely to be hotel reservations or travel agencies, with relevant Airbnb listings only being shown if the Airbnb keyword is inserted. This may suggest that the company needs to invest more in search engine optimization to ensure that its listings rank highly.

Lack of Quality Control

Since Airbnb does not own the properties which it advertises, you can only do so much to ensure quality control amongst its listings. The company has made some efforts to make sure that guests enjoy the very best experience. This includes things such as host identity verification, personally inspecting listings when possible, their dual rating system, enforcing accurate descriptions of the available amenities as well as providing 24/7 customer care services to travelers. However, despite all their efforts, there are still significant complaints about the quality of listings by hosts.

Airbnb Opportunities

Let’s look at some helpful ideas which could drive further growth and development for Airbnb.

Expansion Into New Markets

While Airbnb is officially available in over 220 countries and 100,000 cities, its prominence within these regions differs significantly. As expected, most of its revenue is generated from its North American market. However, this exposes the brand to significant downturns in the economy of its major market.

The brand can make significant efforts to expand its markets in developing economies such as Latin America, the Middle East, and Africa. Also, even though the brand has a significant presence in Europe, especially the major cities like London, Paris, Rome, and Madrid, it is much less popular in other parts of Europe. This is unfortunate because Airbnb listings are some of the best ways to enjoy an authentic local travel experience.

Acquiring Further Strategic Partnerships and Acquisitions

Even though the company is well-known for its strategic partnerships and acquisitions, it can further invest in this area, allowing it to reduce competition and increase its competitive advantage within the market. This includes diversifying into other areas associated with the rental and hospitality industry as well.

Changes In How People Want To Experience Leisure Travel

Previously, when people spoke about leisure travel, they mainly meant prepackaged tours to well-known locations and staying at traditional hotel chains. However, a good number of people now want an authentic local experience that allows them to interact with natives and better understand the culture of the area they are visiting.

To do this, they will need an accommodation option that immerses them right in the midst of the natives and makes local attractions more accessible. Interacting with native hosts is also a great way to learn about the culture they are visiting instead of being subjected to prepackaged tours.

Increased Focus on Luxury Rentals

Just as some travelers are looking for more cozy and immersive rentals to enjoy an authentic travel experience, some renters would instead enjoy an exotic, luxurious holiday. By increasing the number of luxury listings the platform offers, Airbnb will be able to attract more potential renters from this niche as well as increase their revenue.

Invest In a Seamless Mobile Experience

Many users now make bookings directly from mobile devices. Therefore, by investing in a seamless mobile experience, Airbnb can enhance customer experience and boost bookings.

Airbnb Threats

Let’s explore some of the potential threats to the Airbnb business model.

Increased Competition

Due to the success of Airbnb, many other businesses within the hospitality industry are trying to copy their business model. This will lead to increased competition from rental services, rental agencies, and hotel chains. This competition reduces the market share of the company, driving down profits and eventually constituting a significant threat to its continued success.

Economic Downturns

The travel industry is one which is strongly dependent on the situation of the economy. The struggles faced by various sectors associated with travel and hospitality, such as aviation, rentals, and entertainment, expose the vulnerability of the industry. Airbnb relies on strong positive economic indicators to promote growth and significant downturns such as those caused by pandemics, recessions or war, or a threat to business.

Decreasing Acceptance of Home-Sharing

The aftermath of the Covid pandemic has left a visible mark on the home-sharing culture. Certain people are now reluctant to rent out their properties on Airbnb due to health and safety reasons. Hopefully, as more people around the world are fully vaccinated, and this stigma and fear associated with COVID-19 die down, this trend may also reduce.

Negative Guest Experiences

The hospitality industry is built on positive experiences. Therefore, negative experiences both on behalf of travelers and hosts are a significant threat to the success of the Airbnb business model. Include altercations between hosts and renters, posts canceling reservations, fraudulent listings, overpricing, and so on.

User Data Security Leaks

Airbnb maintains a vast database of user information such as credit card details, rental details, and background verification information. Therefore, a leak would be catastrophic to the reputation of the company as well as expose them to potential lawsuits. Also, user data privacy is one of the most critical contemporary issues within the business world today. There have been accusations that companies such as Airbnb, which maintains such large databases of personal information, could potentially use this information to profit off of their customers.

Conclusion

Airbnb is more than just a rental company. They are major disruptors within the industry and changed how we view leisure vacations, rental accommodations, and the meaning of an authentic holiday experience. The business is showing no signs of slowing growth with strong financial indicators as well as successful marketing, and is well poised to remain a dominant figure in the industry for years to come.
